thread.title: Scorpions move match to Sunday because of weather forecast
thread.title_full: Scorpions move match to Sunday because of weather forecast - San Antonio Express-News

author: Staff Report
title: Scorpions move match to Sunday because of weather forecast
text:
Photo: Robin Jerstad /For The Express-News Image 1 of / 1 Caption
Close
Image 1 of 1 Scorpions’ Eric Hassli battles Ft. Lauderdale’s Franki Sanfilippo during their North American Soccer League match on Oct. 3, 2015, at Toyota Field. Scorpions’ Eric Hassli battles Ft. Lauderdale’s Franki Sanfilippo during their North American Soccer League match on Oct. 3, 2015, at Toyota Field. Photo: Robin Jerstad /For The Express-News Scorpions move match to Sunday because of weather forecast 1 / 1 Back to Gallery Because of severe rain and flooding in Saturday’s weather forecast, the Scorpions have moved their NASL home match against the New York Cosmos to 1 p.m. Sunday at Toyota Field.
All season and individual tickets purchased will be valid for the Sunday game.
“Our No. 1 concern is for the safety and comfort of our fans,” said team president and general manager Howard Cornfield . “Given the severity of the forecast — and particularly the likelihood of flooding —we felt this was the most prudent action to take.”
This marks the first time a Scorpions match has been rescheduled due to inclement weather. Sunday’s 1 p.m. start also will be the earliest kickoff of a home match in club history.
